scenario_name: HelioGrid FY2026 Annual Planning Board Meeting
company_context: HelioGrid Technologies, Inc. – a Series C, venture‑backed company developing modular lithium‑iron‑phosphate battery systems for utility‑scale renewable energy storage. Headquartered in Austin, TX with R&D centers in Germany and Singapore. The company is preparing its FY2026 strategic plan, $250 M operating budget, and a $120 M capital raise to fund its next‑generation GridFlex product line.
meeting_event_details:
Date: Thursday, 12 June 2025
Time: 09:00 – 13:00 Central Daylight Time (CDT)
Duration: 4 hours (including a 30‑minute lunch break)
Location: HelioGrid Headquarters – Boardroom A (5th floor, Austin, TX) and via secure Zoom webcast for remote directors.
Agenda: 
1. Call to Order & Approvals (9:00‑9:10)
2. Review & Approval of Prior Meeting Minutes (9:10‑9:20)
3. CFO Presentation – FY2025 Financial Review & FY2026 Budget (9:20‑10:00)
4. CEO Presentation – FY2026 Strategic Plan, Market Outlook & Product Roadmap (10:00‑10:45)
5. Audit Committee Report – 2024 External Audit Findings & SOX Compliance (10:45‑11:15)
6. Governance Committee Report – Board Charter Update & ESG Policy Adoption (11:15‑11:45)
7. Break (11:45‑12:00)
8. Capital Allocation & Funding Decision – Approval of $120 M Series C Extension (12:00‑12:30)
9. Risk Management Review – Cybersecurity & Supply‑Chain Resilience (12:30‑12:50)
10. Executive Session – Compensation Committee Recommendations (12:50‑13:00)
11. Adjournment (13:00)
stakeholders: Laura Chen – Chair, Board of Directors (Independent)
Michael Patel – Lead Independent Director, Governance Committee
Sofia Ramirez – Venture Capital Partner, Series C Lead Investor (Investor Director)
Rajesh Singh – COO, HelioGrid Technologies (Executive, attends for Q&A)
Linda Wu – ESG Officer, HelioGrid (Presenter for Governance Committee)
Rebecca Liu – Legal Counsel, HelioGrid (Board Secretary)

Remote Directors via Zoom: 
   • Carlos Mendoza – Independent Director
   • Priya Desai – Investor Director, GreenVentures
deliverables: Approved FY2026 strategic plan (including market sizing, product roadmap, and go‑to‑market strategy)
Signed FY2026 operating budget and capital allocation plan ($250 M OPEX, $120 M CAPEX)
Board resolution authorizing the Series C extension financing and related shareholder communication
Audit Committee sign‑off on 2024 external audit report and remediation action plan
Governance Committee approval of updated Board Charter and adoption of HelioGrid ESG Policy
Risk Management report endorsement with mitigation milestones for cyber‑security and supply‑chain risks
Compensation Committee recommendation for FY2026 executive incentive plan
success_criteria: All agenda items completed within the 4‑hour window (≤ 5 % time overrun)
≥ 90 % of board members vote ‘Yes’ on each key resolution (strategic plan, budget, financing, ESG policy)
Board minutes drafted and distributed to all directors within 48 hours of meeting close
Audit findings remediation plan assigned with clear owners and target dates within 2 weeks
ESG policy incorporated into the company’s public sustainability report by 31 July 2025
Capital raise term sheet finalized and signed within 10 business days post‑meeting
constraints: T‑90 planning horizon – all pre‑reads must be circulated no later than 90 days before the meeting (by 13 March 2025)
Budget limit for FY2026 set by the Series C investors at $250 M ± 5 % variance
Regulatory filing deadline for the financing (Form D) is 30 days after board approval
Remote directors require secure Zoom link with two‑factor authentication and a 30‑minute technical rehearsal 48 hours prior
External auditor’s availability limited to a single 30‑minute slot for the audit committee report
workback_prompt: Create a detailed work‑back plan for HelioGrid Technologies’ FY2026 Annual Planning Board Meeting (June 12, 2025). Include all preparatory activities such as board material compilation, pre‑read distribution (T‑90), rehearsal sessions, audit committee report finalization, ESG policy drafting, financing term‑sheet negotiation, and post‑meeting deliverables (minutes, approvals, regulatory filings). Identify owners, dependencies, milestones, and critical path items, ensuring compliance with governance requirements and the constraints listed.
